questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters follows an Agile methodology for its Marketing Cloud projects. The project team creates several types of documents.
Which document should a business analyst use to capture the software and behavioral requirements of the application?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The Functional requirements specification document captures the specific functionality that the system must provide. It outlines the behaviors, features, and interactions that users can expect from the application, making it ideal for capturing software and behavioral requirements.

Selected Answer: A
For capturing both software and behavioral requirements of an application in the context of Agile methodology, the most appropriate type of document would be:

A. Functional Requirements Specification

This document is specifically used to articulate the expected behavior of an application, detailing the functions, features, and capabilities the software must possess in order to fulfill the needs of its users. It is particularly focused on what the system will do (the functionalities) and how it will perform from the user's perspective (behavioral aspects). This makes it ideal for a business analyst to use when detailing the software requirements that need to be addressed during development.

Selected Answer: B
Answer B. Please find definition on https://trailhead.salesforce.com/content/learn/modules/business-analyst_skills-strategies/learn-documentation-types-importance-documentation?trailmix_creator_id=strailhead&trailmix_slug=prepare-for-your-salesforce-business-analyst-credential

FRS
A Functional Requirements Specification is a document that outlines the detailed functionalities and behaviors of the software application. It provides a clear and concise description of what the application is expected to do, how it should behave, and what features it should include. The FRS is essential for guiding the development team in building the application to meet the specified requirements.

(System requirements specification) is a document that typically focuses on the technical aspects and characteristics of the system, such as hardware requirements, software dependencies, and performance metrics.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
